posts.name: Falon Clark
posts.cooked: After imaging my rio 2, I try to use the imaging tool, I click set team to 2537, wait a minute, and then hit reboot, but nothing changes, I still can’t ping the rio over usb or ethernet, I’m plugged right into the rio, no radio, any ideas?

posts.name: Mert Ata BABER
posts.cooked: We had something similar yesterday. I could see it in team number setter but set team button wouldn’t change anything. Re-imaging  the sd card solved it. Might be worth a try.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: Have you tried the WPILib Team Number Setter tool?

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
Tatiman-Dev:

I try to use the imaging tool, I click set team to 2537, wait a minute, and then hit reboot, but nothing changes,

I’m not following what you’re doing. The imaging tool doesn’t have a set team to XXX, nor does it have a reboot button.

posts.name: jamzDoge
posts.cooked: I fixed this issue by going to the IP shown in team number setter and changing to use a static IP (10.25.37.2), for some reason the team number setter didn’t set this IP for us and the rio was stuck at the 200 subnet but after setting it back there were no more issues.

posts.name: Falon Clark
posts.cooked: I mistyped, I meant I used the team number setter, mb

posts.name: Falon Clark
posts.cooked: Like opening the web dashboard with that IP? I tried that, couldn’t get the web dashboard open at any point

posts.name: Falon Clark
posts.cooked: I completely uninstalled the game tools, and tried to reinstall them, only to be met with an error message about the NI USB LAN driver, which was what I wanted to make sure I had, not being able to be installed, Ive attached my log files errorlog.txt (5.7 KB)
